intro: Meibomia pachyrhiza, commonly known as the thick-stemmed meibomia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species with showy flowers and medicinal properties. The plant is characterized by its thick, woody stems and clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite and ovate, with a rough texture. Meibomia pachyrhiza is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
